Author: staunch
Content:
California at least has quite reasonable laws on this stuff. As long as you're not doing anything shifty and you are strictly using own resources and time there's not much to worry about.

Whether you should talk to your employer mostly depends on the company you work for and the laws in your area.\n

Author: bootload
Content:
'... infrastructure is a good fit for open source. We don't believe consumer products are as good a fit ...'

this is a good point. Does MT4 being released as open source mean the source code is no longer the product and the service (source code, hardware, scaling technologies, users) now is?
